Author: Sushisnac
Text: I remember when I was doing cheer I used to guess the weight of all the other flyers to determine if I would get a better position. i dont even get how some of them diet long term, i almost passed out a couple times in the air and during practice and the coach had to chat with everyone and say that they would rather have a heavier flyer who can hit right than one who is light but cant stunt well.

Author: SemicolonButterfly
Text: I managed to turn it off before the end of Ep1 (and then put on To the Bone, lol, sometimes me just has it in for me). They all looked strong but very very slender. Literally my goal body, so it's been on my mind a lot. Having some of that determined-rage-fueled-BMI-focused restriction, with a lot of stomach checks in the mirror and random planking around the house.  Crazy how many sports emphasize borderline unhealthy (or outright unhealthy) weights for female athletes. Distance running, surprising, has this problem. And it's so sad because it's putting them at risk for bone density loss, which is actually going to ixnay running for them :( Makes me very angry at those (frequently male) coaches.
